q: Open Forum, where the transnational financial gotham is usually more inclined to consolatory self-indulgence than to serious tackling of controversial international issues. But on this occasion, Afghanistan was debated and harsh questions were asked- namely, Has the West Failed in Afghanistan? This was an implicit riposte, almost ten years later, to Donald Rumsfeld 's optimistic claim of successful American interventionism. And it clearly exposes a truth, too long neglected, but now self-evident: the failure of the

executive chairman, ''a lot of my time'' will be devoted to dealing with regulators and other government officials, Eric Schmidt said. ''We've got very complicated government issues,'' he said, adding that we move quickly, and we tend to be disruptive at scale. European Union officials opened a formal antitrust probe last year into Google search results, while in China the company opted to shut down its mainland search engine rather than censor results for user queries. Eric Schmidt guided Google past early doubts that it could build a leading ad business around a search engine. He also oversaw the 2004 initial public offering, was the biggest for an internet firm. We view this as evidence of the founders staying fully engaged in the business- a positive, said Citigroup analyst Mark Mahaney . Start of sidebar. Skip to end of sidebar.

gets the job title of co-founder and will work on strategic projects and products. ''For the last 10 years, we have all been equally involved in making decisions,'' Eric Schmidt wrote. This triumvirate approach has real benefits in terms of shared wisdom, and we will continue to discuss the big decisions among the three of us. But we have also agreed to clarify our individual roles so there's clear responsibility and accountability at the top of the company, Eric Schmidt wrote.
